title: Part 4
content:
Part 4

WHEN A RED light illuminated the darkness, smoke soon rose.

I saw a silhouette emerge in the dim light and sat up.

"Sorry. Did I wake you?"

"Don't worry, it's about time I head back."

I had intended to wrap things up by 11 PM, but the date had already changed.

"Being a politician is busy work, working at such a late hour and all."

"It's easier to move around at night than during the day."

Each time we met, Mika's brand of cigarettes would change.

It was a habitual way for her to show that she was tainted by each new man she slept with.

"How long do you intend to keep doing this job?"

"Well, I can't keep doing it forever. I've aged quite a bit since I met you, Atsuomi."

It was vital for a woman to maintain their freshness.

As each year passed, their freshness would decline and decay.

Society didn't acknowledge this. In fact, they disliked even mentioning it. However, only those who understand this succeeded.

They wouldn't stop at using youth as a weapon; they'd acquire other weapons as well.

"Here's my advice. It's about time you quit."

"It's a bit surprising to be hearing that from you, Atsuomi."

Mika laughed amusingly and got up from the bed completely naked.

"Well, I was thinking that it's about time too. However, I can't envision anything beyond this. I can't envision marrying someone and building a happy family with them. Having kids, making mom friends, sending them to elementary school… Hah, I laugh just imagining it."

"You'd manage well."

"I wonder. I'm hardly liked by people of my own gender. It might be a tough fight. Though… maybe I'll take a step forward. You've let me earn a living, and you've even allowed me to dream."

If she just wanted to live decently, Mika's assets would've been enough.

But this woman had acquired a lot of money at a young age.

She must've felt considerably scared about lowering her standard of living.

"I want you to do one big job for me."

"…What?"

I took out the marriage registration form I had prepared and placed it on the table.

"Huh? What's this?"

"I want you to marry me."

"You're joking, right?"

"Of course, I'm not joking."

"Atsuomi…"

Mika approached, her eyes slightly moist… and she showed a faint smile.

"What's your aim? You're not the type to choose someone like me, are you?"

"Do I not look like a man who desires a pure marital life with the woman he loves?"

"Not at all."

"Correct. It's something completely different from the marital life you desire. It's just a facade once you peel back the layers."

I had a future to achieve.

For that, I needed someone like her, an existence with no lingering attachments.

"What do you mean?"

"To progress through my plans, I need a new piece. For that, I need your power."

"Explain it so I can understand."

"A child. A child who shares my blood and flesh. That child will become an important piece for me to rise."

Mika was taken aback, but eventually, she understood what I meant.

"So… you're saying you want me to have your child?"

"That's right. Of course, I'll pay enough to make it worth your while."

"Wait. Why me? If you're willing to pay, there are plenty of women who would be happy to bear a child for you."

"If it were just about money, yes. However, you're convenient in many ways. You have some influence in the financial world and you're good at lying. The important thing is to deceive those around us. If they realize the child is born from an unknown woman, it defeats the purpose."

"I also need to play the role of a good wife… I see. Though, for how long? How many years do you plan to keep up this charade of a marriage?"

"Don't worry. Once you're pregnant, we'll announce it and choose the timing for the ceremony. After the child is born, I'll release you immediately."

She understood, but still couldn't fully grasp the situation.

"There's another reason I chose you. Your background is clearly inferior when measured against conventional social values. Your mother was an uneducated bar hostess. Your sister is the same. It was a family that's gone through repeated marriages and divorces; it was a family leading a life with no value."

"Wow, isn't that a bit too rude…? Even if it's true…"

Even if a superior child were to be born from a superior mother, it would just be because the raw stone was already a diamond.

"It's my role to polish a nondescript stone on the roadside until it shines like a gem—refining a mere stone to surpass a diamond."

"But still…"

"As I said before, deceiving those around us is crucial. It's easy to have an incompetent woman carry out a surrogate pregnancy, but it's impossible to completely hide its artificial scent. It's impossible to deceive the keen-nosed financiers."

It was necessary to take a legitimate route to feature my precious child.

In that respect, since Mika had several connections with me, people would likely perceive our union as a natural flow of events.

"You can freely choose the method. Whether it's artificial insemination or in vitro fertilization, I don't mind. Though, ideally, I want the childbirth to occur within a year to a year and a half."

By entrusting my child to the project, I will further demonstrate the White Room's existence.

This is truly a divine strategy.
